sentences.en: A horse can outstrip a man.
Both sums outstrip the Czech Republic's annual consumption of ginseng of about 1.4 tonnes a year.
sentences.cn: 这两个总数都超过了捷克共和国每年约1.4吨的人参年消费量.

sentences.en: For the moment, China's solid tire industry is of the feature that exports outstrip imports.
sentences.cn: 目前实心轮胎行业以出口为主,进口仅占极少部分.

sentences.en: If they could be turned into usable crops , they could outstrip even Hevea.
sentences.cn: 蒲公英被视为杂草, 是因为它们生命力强,生长迅速.

sentences.en: In 1989 and 1990 demand outstripped supply, and prices went up by more than a third.
sentences.cn: 1989和1990年，需求大于供给，物价上涨了三分之一多。

sentences.en: Tom can outstrip most boys both in sports and in studies.
sentences.cn: 汤姆在运动上和在功课上均能超过一般的孩子.

sentences.en: We outstripped all our competitors in sales last year.
sentences.cn: 去年我们的销售额超过了所有竞争对手。

trans.tran_en: to do something better than someone else or be more successful

trans.tran_cn: 超过，越过，优于，胜于，做得比…更好，跑过，逃脱
trans.tran_en: to do something better than someone else or be more successful
